info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 03 at 3:14AM CST until February 03 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations between 3 and 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Illinois. Portions of central and east central Missouri. * WHEN...Until Noon CST today. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning commute.
info.instruction: The rapid accumulation of snow will make travel extremely difficult, if not impossible. If travel is necessary, be sure to exercise extreme caution. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. In Illinois, the latest road conditions can be obtained at www.gettingaroundillinois.com. In Missouri, the latest road conditions can be obtained at traveler.modot.org/map or by calling 1-888-275-6636. Persons should consider delaying all travel. Motorists should use extreme caution if travel is absolutely necessary. It only takes a small amount of sleet to make roads, bridges, sidewalks and parking lots icy and dangerous. Plan for a slow trip and use caution when approaching turns, bridges and overpasses. Remain alert for rapid changes in road conditions.
